main event: On September 3, 1953, a newspaper photographer and a news reporter observed a yellowish-white light in the sky in Modesto, California.
interesting points: The light appeared to be about one degree above the horizon in the direction of Modesto Airport., The light remained stationary as the observers drove a distance away., The photographer used a Speed Graphic camera with a long exposure to capture the light., Local radar operators did not detect any unidentified targets during the observation., It was the opinion of the investigating officer that the light was likely the flash of a landing light from an aircraft.
